text:
I agree Overleaf is slow, but it allows me to work on LaTeX documents from different computers with different OSes without having to worry about LaTeX distributions and updates etc. Wherever I am my LaTeX environment is the same.
That said, I don't use LaTeX for work (I would like to, but we have a special partnership with Microsoft at work so we are kind of mandated to use Office), and with the type of documents I work on in Overleaf, the lack of speed isn't an issue (I'm not a quick typer anyway).
Oh, and I compile my documents using XeLaTeX. Love the modern Unicode and font support.
